about.title: About Us
about.body:
Room 24 is an award winning specialist music and sound design studio located in North London.

Formed by Simon Little and Ross Wakefield, who between them have 25 years of experience writing and producing music. Their careers have taken them around the world for recording sessions, touring with live bands and DJing.

Room 24 has a stellar line up of session musicians at our disposal, with our own recording studios for live sessions. From creating minimal electronic scores, cinematic soundscapes and writing songs - we pride ourselves in creating high-end music for brands, advertising and events. Rooms 24 are accomplished Sound Designers and Studio Engineers, with a recent D&D award nomination.

Ross Room24

Ross’s musical career includes a string of international releases. He co-founded the band ‘Part-Time Heroes’ releasing two albums which led to Maida Vale sessions for BBC Radio 1 and nominations for Gilles Peterson’s Worldwide Awards.

His ventures into the world of TV and sync composition have been equally prolific. Over the last five years Ross has provided musical ballast for major brands such as MTV, B&Q, Friends Reunited, Rimmel London, Schwarzkopf, BT and Google Chrome. He also has several documentary scores and music library projects under his belt.

Simon Room 24.

Simon started his musical career playing the family piano from the age of 5. He started playing in bands as soon as he was allowed out, and by the time he was 21 he’d discovered a love for vintage keyboards, including his beloved Rhodes electric piano and Hammond organ. He later found he had an equal love of analogue synths, but that’s another story.

Simon has toured the world with Bonobo and Quantic, perfecting the art of musicianship and sleep deprivation. He has also mixed numerous live performances for TV working with bands such as Kasabian, Adele, Florence And The Machine, Robyn and Bombay Bicycle Club. He a master at writing to picture, and has created bespoke music for Virgin Atlantic, Vodafone and Tate Gallery.

Rebecca Grierson

Executive Producer, Room 24

Rebecca began her career in music Radio, working as a Producer for the BBC, producing shows with Gilles Peterson, Mary Anne Hobbs, In New DJ’s We Trust and Huw Stephens. During this time she also produced numerous Maida Vale sessions and music documentaries in New York, Japan and Europe. Rebecca has worked as a Senior Music Consultant helping to create musical identities for retail and travel brands including Mulberry, The Hilton and Espa. She began working as a Music Supervisor in 2011, placing music on adverts and composing music for brands including Honda, Rimmel, Weetabix, Johnnie Walker and Spotify.

home.title: Home
home.body: We are an independent music production studio, producing original composition and sound design.

categories.body: We are passionate about making sounds that tell a story.

items.title: Channel 4 Playlist
items.body: A mixture of our own style of music and sound design was required to go with this great playful series of animated sketches.

items.title: Brazilian Recording Session Part 02
items.body: This was a great day in the studio. Culminating in a wealth of authentic and remixed Samba tracks.

items.title: Brazilian Recording Session Part 01
items.body: A wonderful opportunity to record some incredible Brazilian musicians.

items.title: Littlewoods
items.body: A seasonal musical composition, aired across the major terrestrial channels.

items.title: Microsoft
items.body: The worlds biggest software company asked us to pen a series of six soundtracks to accompany a collection of short films for the launch of their Microsoft Ace Campaign.

items.title: Sir David Attenborough
items.body: David Attenborough and The Natural History Museum recently collaborated to release an app. We were lucky enough to produce all of the music and sound design.

items.title: Schwarzkopf
items.body: Lots of energy, pace and fun wrapped up in what’s proven to be a hugely successful sync direction for us.

items.title: Quidco
items.body: A light-hearted, friendly and energetic soundtrack to accompany an extremely positive animation.

items.title: Quantic & Alice Russell direct to disk a-side
items.body: Nothing digital touched the recording of this vinyl 7" record.
items.description: Quantic & Alice Russell direct to disk a-side

items.title: Virgin Atlantic
items.body: Our original music track for Virgin Atlantic can be heard on every single transatlantic flight.

items.title: Tate Shots
items.body: This original piece of music is one of many Tate Shots that we have scored.

items.title: Suspended Coffee
items.body: We created a musical theme and sound design to help these characters come alive.

items.title: Rimmel London
items.body: It’s all about ‘attitude’ and edge this one. Electro-charged, Rock ‘n Roll to support one of UK fashions biggest exports, none other than Kate Moss.

items.title: Tate Modern Interactive Sound Workshop
items.body: A sound workshop exploring the use of visual audio interfaces and the work of Yayoi Kusama

items.title: Columns
items.body: This moving logo required an explosion of sound to match the exciting animation.

items.title: Shell
items.body: Our original music was made to give a positive look to the future.

items.title: BBC Knowledge
items.body: This wonderful award winning piece called for an abstract musical movement and some futuristic sound design.

items.title: Quantic & Alice Russell direct to disk b-side
items.body: We engineered this musical project, a recording direct to vinyl.
items.description: Quantic & Alice Russell direct to disk b-side

items.title: eHarmony TVC
items.body: We created a brand new track featuring a vocal harmony and top-line from the wonderful singer Stac.

items.title: Louis Vuitton Power Of The Voice
items.body: We were asked to develop a sound piece that explored the power of the human voice. This was incorporated into an interactive event for the staff at Louis Vuitton.
items.description: Louis Vuitton Power Of The Voice

items.title: Tate Britain Sound Installation
items.body: A sound installation exploring the Migration Of Sound, using a custom made 8 channel surround sound sculpture.

items.title: LORD'S TV, THE HOME OF CRICKET
